Package interfaces

Class Moveable

java.lang.Object
interfaces.Moveable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bullet, Player, Ray
public abstract class Moveable extends Object
A representation of an entity-like object that can be moved.

In this context, "entity" refers to an object in the world that has complex properties beyond a regular tile. This definition includes objects that can be moved through some mechanism.

This abstract class tracks the 2-dimensional position and velocity of the object, as well as its size. All these measurements are in tile space, NOT pixel space. When displaying a Moveable object, the pixel position can be calculated using the getTileSize method of the Screen class. See this method for more information on displaying objects.

See Also:
  • Screen

    • Moveable

      public Moveable(double x, double y, double s)
      Constructs a new Moveable object with a zero initial velocity.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-position of the object.
      y - the y-position of the object.
      s - the square size of the object's collision area.

    • getRad

      public double getRad()
      Returns the direction of the velocity component in radians, relative to the unit circle. (Thus, 0 rad == East, PI/2 rad == North, etc). The value returned by this method is always positive and in the interval [0, 2*PI).
      Returns:
      the direction of the velocity component in radians.

    • getSize

      public double getSize()
      Returns the size of this object's collision area.
      Returns:
      the size of this object's collision area.

    • move

      public void move()
      Moves this object based on the velocity assigned to it. This is achieved by adding the x and y components of the velocity to the respective position components. This operation is strictly an addition, so velocity should be negative to move left or up.

    • setX

      public void setX(double x)
      Sets the x position of this object.

    • setV

      Sets the velocity components of this object.
      Parameters:
      vx - the x component of this object's velocity.
      vy - the y component of this object's velocity.

    • setRad

      public void setRad(double rad)
      Sets the rotation of this object. Note that the rotation is also set in the move method.
      Parameters:
      rad - the rotation of this object.
      See Also:
      • move()

    • getType

      public abstract String getType()
      Returns the type of this object as a string. This can be any string, but is recommended to be standardized by a specific Moveable child class.

      This method is separate from the toString, which can be overriden as desired by children.

      Returns:
      the type of this object as a string.
